goal:
WindEurope is the voice of the wind industry, actively promoting the utilisation of wind power in Europe and worldwide.
It now has more than 450 members including manufacturers with a leading share of the world wind power market, component suppliers, research institutes, national wind and renewables associations, developers, electricity providers, finance and insurance companies and consultants.

WindEurope coordinates policy positions, communications, research and analysis and provides various services to support membersâ€™ requirements. WindEurope also organises high-profile industry events.

WindEurope analyses, formulates and establishes policy positions for the wind industry on key issues, cooperating with industry and research institutions on a number of market development and technology research projects.

In addition, the advocacy activities undertaken by WindEurope help create a suitable legal framework within which members can successfully develop their businesses.

WindEurope produces a large variety of information tools and manages campaigns aimed at raising awareness about the benefits of wind, dispelling the myths about wind energy and providing easy access to credible information.

WindEurope organises numerous regular events: conferences, exhibitions, launches, seminars and workshops. These encourage the exchange of international experience on policy, finance and technical developments, and showcase the latest technology.
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Energy, Environment, Trade
euInitiatives:
WindEurope is currently following several major EU files notably the Energy Union implementation and in particular the Clean Energy Package legislative proposals on renewable energy and market design.
WindEurope is also following the ETS structural reform, the report on the implementation of EFSI as well as European Parliament own-initiative reports relevant to EU Climate and Energy.
